root.name: concat()

example.code: sa1 = "OH", "NY", "CA" sa2 = "KY", "IN", "MA" sa3 = concat(sa1, sa2) println(sa3) # Prints updated list contents to the console: # [0] "OH" # [1] "NY" # [2] "CA" # [3] "KY" # [4] "IN" # [5] "MA"

root.description:
Concatenates two lists. For example, concatenating the list [1, 2, 3] and the list [4, 5, 6] yields [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]. Both parameters must be lists of the same datatype.

When using an array of objects, the data returned from the function must be cast to the object array's data type. For example: SomeClass[] items = (SomeClass[]) concat(array1, array2).
